summary: This document is an email chain between a Department of Justice/Bureau of Prisons staff attorney and a Southern District of New York Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding the replacement of a broken hard drive for Ghislaine Maxwell while she was detained at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn. It includes a sensitive/privileged communication header and details the logistical arrangements.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the correspondence; a replacement hard drive is being sent to her at the detention center after she broke her previous one.

persons.name: Hon. Nathan
persons.context: Recipient of an attached letter from the DOJ/BOP staff attorney, mentioned in the email.

persons.name: Staff Attorney
persons.context: Sender of the email from the Department of Justice Federal Bureau of Prisons, transmitting a letter to Judge Nathan.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Sender of the initial email requesting that a replacement hard drive be given to Maxwell and the broken one be returned to the SDNY office.

persons.name: Paralegal Specialist
persons.context: The individual at the U.S. Attorney's Office, SDNY, to whom the broken drive should be mailed.

connections.description: The AUSA is part of the prosecution team handling Maxwell's case and is arranging for her to receive legal materials (a hard drive).
The Staff Attorney is sending a letter to Judge Nathan, indicating official court-related communication.

events.title: Replacement Drive Arranged for Maxwell
events.description: The SDNY office sends a replacement hard drive via FedEx to Ghislaine Maxwell at the MDC to replace one she recently dropped and broke.

events.title: Letter to Judge Nathan
events.description: A DOJ/BOP Staff Attorney transmits a letter to Hon. Nathan, attached to an email.

locations: Metropolitan Detention Center Brooklyn, Brooklyn, New York 11232
U.S. Attorney's Office, SDNY, New York, NY 10007
1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell broke a hard drive while detained at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn, necessitating a replacement from the prosecution.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York arranged for a new hard drive to be delivered to Maxwell via FedEx on December 3, 2020.
The correspondence is marked as a SENSITIVE/PRIVILEGED COMMUNICATION, indicating the legal sensitivity of the materials involved.
The document shows logistical coordination between the prosecution (SDNY AUSA) and detention authorities (DOJ/BOP Staff Attorney) regarding a defendant's access to legal materials.
